metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8658 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the brcmf_cfg80211_start_ap function in drivers/net/wireless/broadcom/brcm80211/brcmfmac/cfg80211.c in the Linux kernel before 4.7.5 allows local users to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a long SSID Information Element in a command to a Netlink socket. Daxing Guo discovered a stack-based buffer overflow in the Broadcom IEEE802.11n FullMAC driver in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly gain privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8658` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
